adjective.definition: Occurring, found, or done often; prevalent.
adjective.example: Salt and pepper are the two most common seasonings.

adjective.definition: Shared by, coming from, or done by two or more people, groups, or things.
adjective.example: The two countries have a common border.

noun.definition: A piece of open land for public use, especially in a village or town.
noun.example: The children played football on the common.

verb.definition: To share or participate in something (archaic).
verb.example: They commoned together at the same table.

verb.definition: To have the right of pasture on common land.

usage_examples: It is a common mistake to make.
We are working towards a common goal.
